content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is a possible implementation of the `extract_julia_code` function in Julia:

```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString)
    blocks = Markdown.Parser.parse(md)
    code_blocks = filter(block -> block isa Markdown.Code, blocks)
    code = join(map(block -> replace(block.code, r"```julia\n" => ""), code_blocks), "\n")
    return code
end
```

This function uses the `Markdown` package to parse the markdown document and extract the code blocks. It then filters out any non-code blocks and removes the code fences from the remaining blocks. Finally, it joins the code blocks together with a newline and returns the resulting string.
